name: artemis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in Greek mythology (= ancient stories), a goddess (= female god) who is usually shown as a hunter with a bow and arrows: the Temple of Artemis Compare
Diana
More examplesFewer examplesArchaeologists found two statues of Artemis.Daphne was a hunter who dedicated herself to Artemis, goddess of the hunt, and, like the goddess, refused to marry. He came upon Artemis, the goddess of chastity, while she was bathing.The play shows Agamemnon's struggle after the goddess Artemis decrees that his fleet will not have a favourable wind to sail to Troy until he sacrifices his daughter, Iphigenia.
